channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Warren Buffett is retiring: We look back at a critical turning point in his career
item.description: Warren Buffett started out by identifying opportunities in undervalued companies. Later, his strategy was buying a company that would get bigger on its own. We look at that second phase of his career.
item.content:encoded: Warren Buffett started out by identifying opportunities in undervalued companies. Later, his strategy was buying a company that would get bigger on its own. We look at that second phase of his career.

item.title: Ukraine's energy workers fight to keep the power on
item.description: Ukraine's power plant employees are battling to keep the infrastructure running in the face of Russian attacks.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's power plant employees are battling to keep the infrastructure running in the face of Russian attacks.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu discussed peace deal, Iran and more in meeting
item.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu in Florida as the men discuss peace plans in the Middle East.
item.content:encoded: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu in Florida as the men discuss peace plans in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Detroit is about to get its first woman mayor with Democrat Mary Sheffield
item.description: Detroit gets its first new mayor in a dozen years, as 38-year-old Mary Sheffield is sworn in. Sheffield also becomes Detroit's first woman mayor.
item.content:encoded: Detroit gets its first new mayor in a dozen years, as 38-year-old Mary Sheffield is sworn in. Sheffield also becomes Detroit's first woman mayor.
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: The reason behind the flip-flop boycott in Brazil
item.description: Angry over a new ad campaign for the famous Brazilian sandal brand Havaianas, the right is trying to get consumers to boycott the iconic flip flops.
item.content:encoded: Angry over a new ad campaign for the famous Brazilian sandal brand Havaianas, the right is trying to get consumers to boycott the iconic flip flops.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Wildlife crossings save animals, people and billions in vehicular damage costs
item.description: Car crashes with wildlife kill about 200 Americans every year. Federal funding is helping states build safe animal crossings to reduce the carnage.
item.content:encoded: Car crashes with wildlife kill about 200 Americans every year. Federal funding is helping states build safe animal crossings to reduce the carnage.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Daniel

item.title: Trump sent in the National Guard to fight crime in 2025. Results were unclear
item.description: We look at the use of the National Guard by President Trump — as well as the Democratic governor of New Mexico — in cities with higher-than-average crime. How effective can we say the Guard have been?
item.content:encoded: We look at the use of the National Guard by President Trump — as well as the Democratic governor of New Mexico — in cities with higher-than-average crime. How effective can we say the Guard have been?
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: When ice and snow build up on the roads, this woman heads out for a drive
item.description: Driving a snowplow isn't for everyone. It means long hours driving a tank-like truck, and always in weather that would keep many folks at home. We take a ride with a young woman who loves her job.
item.content:encoded: Driving a snowplow isn't for everyone. It means long hours driving a tank-like truck, and always in weather that would keep many folks at home. We take a ride with a young woman who loves her job.
item.dc:creator: Emily Russell

item.title: A top chef weighs in on recipe ideas for the Kwanzaa table
item.description: The weeklong celebration of Kwanzaa is a perfect opportunity to revisit soothing, hearty winter foods, says celebrity chef Tanya Holland.
item.content:encoded: The weeklong celebration of Kwanzaa is a perfect opportunity to revisit soothing, hearty winter foods, says celebrity chef Tanya Holland.
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: A college student in her 60s shares wisdom when it comes to reinventing oneself
item.description: Joan Steidl, who is now retired, shares her reinvention takeaways. She has a podcast about confronting the generational divide, takes comedy workshops and went back to college.
item.content:encoded: Joan Steidl, who is now retired, shares her reinvention takeaways. She has a podcast about confronting the generational divide, takes comedy workshops and went back to college.
